metadata.title: CVE-2016-9577 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was discovered in SPICE before 0.13.90 in the server'sprotocol handling. An authenticated attacker could send crafted messages tothe SPICE server causing a heap overflow leading to a crash or possiblecode execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.4
spice-client - 0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spice package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.4-0nocelt2ubuntu1.4').
